title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. The definition of independence for two events A and B states that P(A AND B) must equal P(A) × P(B).

$$2$$. Given:
• P(A) $$=$$ $$0.5$$
• P(B) $$=$$ $$0.5$$
• P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0.20$$

$$3$$. Compute P(A) × P(B):
P(A) × P(B) $$=$$ $$0.5$$ × $$0.5$$ $$=$$ $$0.25$$

$$4$$. Compare P(A AND B) to P(A) × P(B):
• P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0.20$$
• P(A) × P(B) $$=$$ $$0.25$$

$$5$$. Since P(A AND B) $$ 
eq $$ P(A) × P(B), events A and B are not independent.

Answer: No
